data.title: It’s Pink Ribbon Breakfast Day! For Bridget, Aotearoa New Zealand Country Manager at @xero, this campaign is personal - she was diagnosed...
data.meta_description:
217 likes, 4 comments - pinkribbonnz on May 22, 2024: "It’s Pink Ribbon Breakfast Day!

For Bridget, Aotearoa New Zealand Country Manager at @xero, this campaign is personal - she was diagnosed with breast cancer at the age of 40.

“I had booked myself in for my first mammogram and was given the all-clear, so I was shocked when I was told I had breast cancer two months later.

I had checked my breasts regularly but perhaps had not been doing the checks thoroughly enough or even correctly – because I naively never imagined I would be a candidate for breast cancer.

I didn’t even know there were different types of breast cancer, so at first I didn’t know what triple negative meant. When my specialist said they were aiming for a cure, that’s what I was focused on. As a friend had said to me, I had to get on the train, strap on for a ride and get through to the other end. So that’s what I did.

Sharing my experience is my way of spreading the message to create awareness which is why it’s so special that my workplace, Xero, has jumped on board to become a Pink Ribbon Breakfast sponsor this year.

Today is all about supporting the more than 5,500 incredible people all around the country who are fundraising today. Please donate so we can ensure more Kiwis learn about the signs and symptoms of breast cancer.”

Donate now at the link in our bio".
